intro: Lasiandra, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It comprises several species, many of which are native to Australia and the Mediterranean region. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their woody stems and showy, often pink or red flowers. Lasiandra species are known for their ability to thrive in rocky or arid environments, making them well-adapted to harsh conditions. Their flowers are usually arranged in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
